snippet: Ken Loach’s new film, “The Angels’ Share,” is about four unemployed Scottish scofflaws who cook up a scheme to steal a valuable cask of whisky.
abstract: Ken Loach film The Angels' Share, about four young unemployed Glaswegians who journey to Scottish Highlands and cook up scheme to steal and sell valuable cask of whiskey, is fish-out-of-water satire about Scots in Scotland; world presented in film clashes with quaint, tourist-oriented view of Scotland.
lead_paragraph: Ken Loach’s new film, “The Angels’ Share,” is about four unemployed Scottish scofflaws who cook up a scheme to steal a valuable cask of whisky.

headline.seo: ‘The Angels’ Share’ Is Ken Loach’s New Film Set in Scotland
headline.main: Beneath the Kilt, a Modern Scotland
headline.print_headline: Beneath the Kilt, a Modern Scotland
